com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback Interface Reference

Inherited by com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

abstract void subtitleCallback (int[] buffer, int width, int height, int type, boolean display)
abstract void videoFrameCallback (String type, long[] nativeBuffer, int width, int height, int[] stride)

Package Functions

abstract void eventCallback (String[] eventArray)

Detailed Description

Callback interface to be implemented by a class to receive event notifications from the Player Control.

Author:
Cidana, Inc.
Version:
2.0

Use Cipl.SetEventCallback() to set this interface.

Member Function Documentation

abstract void com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.eventCallback ( String[]  eventArray) [package, pure virtual]

Event callback function from the Player Control.

eventCallback must be implemented from this interface to handle events from the Player Control Manager. These events are generated asynchronous to the function calls. For example, device change, playlist change, uop change.

Parameters:
eventArrayA string array of 3 strings.
eventArray[0] is Session name which generates event (may be null or empty)
eventArray[1] Event name string blob: (event_name>)''(Param1)''(Param2). It is recommended to ignore Param1 and Param2. If the event is not user servicable, it will be of form 0xhhhhhhhh (a hex value).
eventArray[2] Event data string blob This is implementation dependent.
Following is the list of event_name:

  

  




// Event codes for Source Device Manager interfaces CIPL_SDM_DeviceArrival // Indicate device has arrival CIPL_SDM_DeviceRemoved // Signal a device has being removed,return source name CIPL_SDM_DeviceCollected // Signal device collection finished CIPL_SDM_DeviceOpened // Source device opened CIPL_SDM_DeviceLockStatus // Source device locked CIPL_SDM_DeviceUnlockStatus // Source device unlocked CIPL_SDM_DeviceOpTimeout // Source device operation timeout


	// Event codes for Media PLayer interfaces
	CIPL_MPL_StateChanged			// Media player state changed, return current stream state, for example "Uninitialized, Opened, Stopped...Running..."
	CIPL_MPL_UOPChanged			// Media player User Operation changed, return current user operation, for example "CIPL_UOP_PLAY, CIPL_UOP_CHAPTERPLAY... CIPL_UOP_SEEK..." 
	CIPL_MPL_AudioVolume			// Media player audio volume changed, return current audio volume
	CIPL_MPL_CurrFileEOF			// Media player stop when reach end of current file, return current stream state when EOF and speed of current file
	CIPL_MPL_VideoSrcChanged		// Media player video display width/height changed, return width and height of current video
	CIPL_MPL_SubtitleText			// Media player send a text string out for UI display subtitle, return a text string of subtitle  
	CIPL_MPL_UOPDenied			// Media player notify application the last UOP is denied, return current user operation and stream state
	CIPL_MPL_SpeedChanged			// Media player notify application the play speed is changed, return current speed
	CIPL_MPL_FirstVideoFrame		// Media player notify to present first frame of video
	CIPL_MPL_FirstAudioFrame		// Media player notify to present first frame of audio
	CIPL_MPL_VideoInfoReady			// Media player notify to video information is recognized
	CIPL_MPL_AudioInfoReady			// Media player notify to audio information is recognized
	CIPL_MPL_FatalError			// Media player notify to fatal error, return CIPL_FatalErrorType,for example"Demux, Video Decoder,..."
	CIPL_MPL_SubtitleOutput			// Media player notify to raw subtitle data
	CIPL_MPL_FirstData			// Media player notify to received first A/V data
	CIPL_MPL_AudioPCMOutput			// Media player notify to raw audio PCM data output, return information of PCM frame data
	CIPL_MPL_AudioSpectrum			// Media player notify to spectrum of PCM changes, return information of spectrum bar array
	CIPL_MPL_EQStatusChanged		// Media player notify to equalizer status changed, return current status and current type of effect
	CIPL_MPL_MemoryWarning			// Media player notify low memory warning, return as:"Low Memory:(remain memory size in KBytes)"
	CIPL_MPL_ResolutionErr			// Media player notify to video resolution is not supported
	CIPL_MPL_SubtitleReady			// Media player notify to subtitle information is recognized
	CIPL_MPL_VideoFrameOutput       // Media player notify of raw video frame
	// Event codes for 'TV' Control interfaces
	CIPL_TVC_InitialStart			// Tuner initialize start
	CIPL_TVC_InitialEnd			// Tuner initialize end, return error code and redirect URL/FILE for retry base on the current source is not available
	CIPL_TVC_DeinitialStart			// Tuner de-initialize start
	CIPL_TVC_DeinitialEnd			// Tuner de-initialize end, return error code
	CIPL_TVC_ScanBegin			// Tuner channel scan begin
	CIPL_TVC_ScanProgress			// Tuner channel scan in progress, return percent done, current frequency (or channelNum), and total services.
	CIPL_TVC_ScanCanceled			// Tuner channel scan been canceled, return percent done, and current frequency
	CIPL_TVC_ScanEnd			// Tuner channel scan finished, return number of frequency locked and total services
	CIPL_TVC_ServiceChanging		// Channel Service is changing
	CIPL_TVC_ServiceChanged			// Channel Service is changed, return error code
	CIPL_TVC_StreamTimeGet			// Get time from stream, return time zone offset in seconds and time information
	CIPL_TVC_SignalChanged			// Notifies application that the signal quality is changed, return the quality level of signal, for example"Lost, Weak,...Good"
	CIPL_TVC_SubtitleChanged		// Notifies application that the subtitle is changed
	CIPL_TVC_CaptionChanged			// Notifies application that the closed caption is changed
	CIPL_TVC_ParentalBlock			// Notifies application that video and audio blocked by parental control
	CIPL_TVC_ParentalPass			// Notifies application that video and audio passed by parental control
	CIPL_TVC_AudioChanged			// Notifies application that audio language stream is changed 
	CIPL_TVC_SigQltCtrl			// Notifies application that the signal quality control is changed, return signal quality control,for example"Signal Fine, Signal Weak,Signal Lost"
	CIPL_TVC_NWConnecting			// Notifies application that SDK is connecting network media server
	CIPL_TVC_NWConnected			// Notifies application that SDK connected network media server
	CIPL_TVC_NWConnectFailed		// Notifies application that SDK connection failed
	CIPL_TVC_NWInterrupted			// Notifies application that network connection is interrupted
	CIPL_TVC_NWReconnecting			// Notifies application that SDK try to reconnect media server with retried times
	CIPL_TVC_NWReconnected			// Notifies application that SDK get network link reconnected
	CIPL_TVC_NWUnavailable			// Notifies application that network is unavailable
	CIPL_TVC_NWBuffering			// Notifies application that network stream buffering time, the parameters are start and end time
	CIPL_TVC_SDBatteryChanged		// Notifies device battery info changed, return "BatteryPct AC:ON/OFF"
	CIPL_TVC_BcasCardRemoved 		// Notify TVControl that B-CAS card already removed from device 
	CIPL_TVC_BcasCardInserted		// Notify TVControl that B-CAS card already inserted from device 
	CIPL_TVC_SignalQualityTest		// Notify Application that signal quality test start 
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_ScanStart			// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery scanning start
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_ScanProgress		// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery scanning in progress
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_ScanEnd			// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery scanning finished
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_ScanCancel			// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery scanning canceled
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_RelayScan			// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery in relay station scanning, return "CH(physical channel number) or scanning frequency KHz"
	CIPL_TVC_OOC_AffiliationScan		// Notify application that the OOC (out of coverage) recovery in affiliation station scanning, return "CH(physical channel number) or scanning frequency KHz"
	CIPL_TVC_CurrServiceRemoved		// Notify application that the current service is removed
	CIPL_TVC_LockUpdating			// Notifies application that TVControl is locked to updating
	CIPL_TVC_UnlockUpdated			// Notifies application that TVControl finished updating
	CIPL_TVC_SignalInfo				// Notifies application that tuner signal additional information, return additional information in string
	CIPL_TVC_DSMCCMessage			// Notifies application that tuner signal additional information, return string is the message from DSMCC
	CIPL_TVC_SignalReport			// Notifies application signal strength and quality in percentage, return string is format to "strength quality"
	// Event codes for Program Guide Data interfaces
	CIPL_PGD_LockUpdating			// Notifies application that PG is locked for updating
	CIPL_PGD_ServiceAdd			// Notifies application that services in PG is added, return ServiceRemain
	CIPL_PGD_ServiceRemove			// Notifies application that services in PG is deleted, return ServiceRemain
	CIPL_PGD_ServiceUpdate			// Notifies application that services in PG is updated, return ServiceRemain
	CIPL_PGD_ProgramAdd			// Notifies application that programs in PG is added
	CIPL_PGD_ProgramRemove			// Notifies application that programs in PG is deleted
	CIPL_PGD_ProgramUpdate			// Notifies application that programs in PG is updated
	CIPL_PGD_ScheduleAdd			// Notifies application that schedules in PG is added
	CIPL_PGD_ScheduleRemove			// Notifies application that schedules in PG is deleted
	CIPL_PGD_ScheduleUpdate			// Notifies application that schedules in PG is updated
	CIPL_PGD_UnlockUpdated			// Notifies application that PG updating is finished
	CIPL_PGD_ServiceInfoUpdated		// Notifies application that service information updated, this information is not related with playback, doesn't required restart playback,return ServiceRemain
	CIPL_PGD_ProgramEncrypted 		// Notifies application that current program is encrypted, return ServiceId and ProgramId 
	CIPL_PGD_ProgramFreeToAir		// Notifies application that current program is free to air, return ServiceId and ProgramId
	CIPL_PGD_VideoDescription 		// Notifies application that current program's video description update, return ServiceId and video description
	CIPL_PGD_ServiceResorting		// Notifies application that current service list is resorted, need to update
	// Event codes for Conditional Access interfaces
	CIPL_CAS_SmartCardStatus		// Smart card status event
	CIPL_CAS_StatusUpdated			// CA status updated, return CA status information
	// Event codes for Emergency Alert System message interfaces
	CIPL_EAS_AlertStatus			// Notifies application that emergency alert is on/off, convert the EAS Event into a output string
	// Event codes for Power Management
	CIPL_PWM_StatusChanged			// Notifies application of a change in the power status.
	CIPL_PWM_ResumeAutomatic		// Notifies application that the device has woken up automatically
	CIPL_PWM_ResumeSuspend			// Notifies application that the system has resumed operation 
	CIPL_PWM_Suspend			// Notifies application that the system is about to enter a 
	CIPL_PWM_BatteryChanged			// Notifies application that the battery status is changed with warning 
	CIPL_PWM_MemoryReport			// Notifies application of current free memory
	// Event codes for Media Record
	CIPL_MRE_CreateNewFile			// Notifies application of media record create a new file, return the new file name
	CIPL_MRE_NoDiskSpace			// Notifies application of no disk space in current recording folder, return path of recorder fileName
	CIPL_MRE_OutOfFileLmt			// Notifies application of recording out of the setting total file limitation.
	CIPL_MRE_PathNotFound			// Notifies application of record path is not exist, and report temporary record path
	CIPL_MRE_FileFinished			// Notifies application of one recording file is finished
	CIPL_MRE_ChannelRedirect		// notify application to redirect to other service before recording, return "CurrService:current channel index,RedirectService:Redirect Channel index"
	CIPL_MRE_CreateFileFailed		// notify application that can not create record file.
	CIPL_MRE_RecordingFailed 		// notify application that can not recording.
	// Event codes for Time Shifting
	CIPL_TSH_PathNotFound			// Notifies application of time shifting path is not exist, and report time shifting record path
	// Event codes for GUI operation
	CIPL_GUI_Back2MainWnd
	CIPL_GUI_Minimize
	CIPL_GUI_Restore
	CIPL_GUI_Hide
	CIPL_GUI_Show
	CIPL_GUI_Exit
	CIPL_GUI_ChangeFile
	// Event codes for Media Snap Shot
	CIPL_MSS_FileSaveStart			// Notifies application of snapshot start save to a file, return the file name and absolute path
	CIPL_MSS_FileSaveEnd			// Notifies application of snapshot finish saving a file, return the file name and absolute path
	CIPL_MSS_FileIOError			// Notifies application of snapshot meet a error of file I/O
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailStart			// Notifies application of thumbnail start save to a file, return the file name and absolute path
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailEnd			// Notifies application of thumbnail finish saving a file, return the file name and absolute path
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailCancel		// Notifies application of thumbnail canceled in errors
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailRawMem		// Notifies application of thumbnail output image in RAW format
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailBmpMem		// Notifies application of thumbnail output image in BMP format, return a string buffer in BASE64 type
	CIPL_MSS_ThumbnailJpgMem		// Notifies application of thumbnail output image in JPEG format
	// Event codes for Media Setting
	CIPL_MST_SettingError			// Notifies application of setting failed with error code
	// Event codes reserved for customers (OEM)
	CIPL_OEM_Base				// [Group of event codes for customers, usually no need, just for reserved]
	CIPL_OEM_End				// Event codes end up

          abstract void com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.subtitleCallback

           [pure virtual]
        

      






Raw subtitle data callback function from player control.


subtitleCallback must be implemented from this interface to handle raw subtitle data callback from Player Control Manager. This interface will not invoked by default, you can use "set subtitleoutput" to set subtitle output on/off and raw data format.


Parameters:

  

    
bufferThe raw data in int buffer. 

 width Width of subtitle. 

 height Height of subtitle. 

 type Format of raw subtitle data, 0 for YUV420 1 for ARGB8888 

 display Display or not, true for display this frame, false for erase last display. 

  

  





Implemented in com.cidana.cipl.Cipl.











      

        

          abstract void com.cidana.cipl.CiplCallback.videoFrameCallback 
          (
          String 
          type, 
        

        

          
          
          long[] 
          nativeBuffer, 
        

        

          
          
          int 
          width, 
        

        

          
          
          int 
          height, 
        

        

          
          
          int[] 
          stride 
        

        

          
          )
           [pure virtual]
        

      






Raw video frame buffer callback function from player control.


videoFrameCallback must be implemented from this interface to handle raw video frame buffer callback from Player Control Manager. This interface will not invoked by default, you can use "set videoframeoutput" to set video frame output on/off.


Parameters:

  

    
typeFormat of the video frame 

 nativeBuffer An int array contains the pointer(s) to the native buffer of the raw video frame. The count of the pointer(s) (i.e. array size) depends on the format of the raw video frame 

 width Width of video frame. (Count in pixel) 

 height Height of video frame. (Count in pixel) 

 stride Length of row in a video frame. (Count in byte) Due to the performance impact and requirement of the alignment of memory address, the actual space allocated for each row of a video frame may larger than [video frame width]*[bytes per pixel]
